teks_text: Reading/Fluency. Students read grade-level text with fluency and comprehension. Students are expected to read aloud grade-level stories with fluency (rate, accuracy, expression, appropriate phrasing) and comprehension.
aware_text: read aloud grade-level stories with fluency (rate, accuracy, expression, appropriate phrasing) and comprehension.

reporting_category: Reading/Comprehension of Informational Text/Culture and History
teks_text: Reading/Comprehension of Informational Text/Culture and History. Students analyze, make inferences and draw conclusions about the author's purpose in cultural, historical, and contemporary contexts and provide evidence from the text to support their understanding. Students are expected to explain the difference between a stated and an implied purpose for an expository text.
aware_text: explain the difference between a stated and an implied purpose for an expository text.

teks_text: Reading/Comprehension of Informational Text/Expository Text. Students analyze, make inferences and draw conclusions about expository text and provide evidence from text to support their understanding. Students are expected to:
aware_text: Reading/Comprehension of Informational Text/Expository Text. Students analyze, make inferences and draw conclusions about expository text and provide evidence from text to support their understanding.

teks_text: summarize the main idea and supporting details in text in ways that maintain meaning;
aware_text: summarize the main idea and supporting details in text in ways that maintain meaning.

teks_text: distinguish fact from opinion in a text and explain how to verify what is a fact;
aware_text: distinguish fact from opinion in a text and explain how to verify what is a fact.

teks_text: describe explicit and implicit relationships among ideas in texts organized by cause-and-effect, sequence, or comparison; and
aware_text: describe explicit and implicit relationships among ideas in texts organized by cause-and-effect, sequence, or comparison.

teks_text: use multiple text features (e.g., guide words, topic and concluding sentences) to gain an overview of the contents of text and to locate information.
aware_text: use multiple text features (e.g., guide words, topic and concluding sentences) to gain an overview of the contents of text and to locate information.

teks_text: Reading/Comprehension of Informational Text/Persuasive Text. Students analyze, make inferences and draw conclusions about persuasive text and provide evidence from text to support their analysis. Students are expected to explain how an author uses language to present information to influence what the reader thinks or does.
aware_text: explain how an author uses language to present information to influence what the reader thinks or does.

teks_text: Reading/Comprehension of Informational Text/Procedural Texts. Students understand how to glean and use information in procedural texts and documents. Students are expected to:
aware_text: Reading/Comprehension of Informational Text/Procedural Texts. Students understand how to glean and use information in procedural texts and documents.

teks_text: determine the sequence of activities needed to carry out a procedure (e.g., following a recipe); and
aware_text: determine the sequence of activities needed to carry out a procedure (e.g., following a recipe).

teks_text: explain factual information presented graphically (e.g., charts, diagrams, graphs, illustrations).
aware_text: explain factual information presented graphically (e.g., charts, diagrams, graphs, illustrations).

teks_text: Reading/Media Literacy. Students use comprehension skills to analyze how words, images, graphics, and sounds work together in various forms to impact meaning. Students continue to apply earlier standards with greater depth in increasingly more complex texts. Students are expected to:
aware_text: Reading/Media Literacy. Students use comprehension skills to analyze how words, images, graphics, and sounds work together in various forms to impact meaning. Students continue to apply earlier standards with greater depth in increasingly more complex texts.

teks_text: explain the positive and negative impacts of advertisement techniques used in various genres of media to impact consumer behavior;
aware_text: explain the positive and negative impacts of advertisement techniques used in various genres of media to impact consumer behavior.

teks_text: explain how various design techniques used in media influence the message (e.g., pacing, close-ups, sound effects); and
aware_text: explain how various design techniques used in media influence the message (e.g., pacing, close-ups, sound effects).

teks_text: compare various written conventions used for digital media (e.g. language in an informal e-mail vs. language in a web-based news article).
aware_text: compare various written conventions used for digital media (e.g. language in an informal e-mail vs. language in a web-based news article).

teks_text: Writing/Writing Process. Students use elements of the writing process (planning, drafting, revising, editing, and publishing) to compose text. Students are expected to:
aware_text: Writing/Writing Process. Students use elements of the writing process (planning, drafting, revising, editing, and publishing) to compose text.

teks_text: plan a first draft by selecting a genre appropriate for conveying the intended meaning to an audience and generating ideas through a range of strategies (e.g., brainstorming, graphic organizers, logs, journals);
aware_text: plan a first draft by selecting a genre appropriate for conveying the intended meaning to an audience and generating ideas through a range of strategies (e.g., brainstorming, graphic organizers, logs, journals).

teks_text: develop drafts by categorizing ideas and organizing them into paragraphs;
aware_text: develop drafts by categorizing ideas and organizing them into paragraphs.

teks_text: revise drafts for coherence, organization, use of simple and compound sentences, and audience;
aware_text: revise drafts for coherence, organization, use of simple and compound sentences, and audience.

teks_text: edit drafts for grammar, mechanics, and spelling using a teacher-developed rubric; and
aware_text: edit drafts for grammar, mechanics, and spelling using a teacher-developed rubric.

teks_text: revise final draft in response to feedback from peers and teacher and publish written work for a specific audience.
aware_text: revise final draft in response to feedback from peers and teacher and publish written work for a specific audience.

teks_text: Writing/Literary Texts. Students write literary texts to express their ideas and feelings about real or imagined people, events, and ideas. Students are expected to:
aware_text: Writing/Literary Texts. Students write literary texts to express their ideas and feelings about real or imagined people, events, and ideas.

teks_text: write imaginative stories that build the plot to a climax and contain details about the characters and setting; and
aware_text: write imaginative stories that build the plot to a climax and contain details about the characters and setting.

teks_text: write poems that convey sensory details using the conventions of poetry (e.g., rhyme, meter, patterns of verse).
aware_text: write poems that convey sensory details using the conventions of poetry (e.g., rhyme, meter, patterns of verse).

teks_text: Writing. Students write about their own experiences. Students are expected to write about important personal experiences.
aware_text: write about important personal experiences.

teks_text: Writing/Expository and Procedural Texts. Students write expository and procedural or work-related texts to communicate ideas and information to specific audiences for specific purposes. Students are expected to:
aware_text: Writing/Expository and Procedural Texts. Students write expository and procedural or work-related texts to communicate ideas and information to specific audiences for specific purposes.

teks_text: create brief compositions that:
aware_text: create brief compositions that

aware_text: create brief compositions that establish a central idea in a topic sentence.

teks_text: include supporting sentences with simple facts, details, and explanations; and
aware_text: create brief compositions that include supporting sentences with simple facts, details, and explanations.

teks_text: contain a concluding statement;
aware_text: create brief compositions that contain a concluding statement.

teks_text: write letters whose language is tailored to the audience and purpose (e.g., a thank you note to a friend) and that use appropriate conventions (e.g., date, salutation, closing); and
aware_text: write letters whose language is tailored to the audience and purpose (e.g., a thank you note to a friend) and that use appropriate conventions (e.g., date, salutation, closing).

teks_text: write responses to literary or expository texts and provide evidence from the text to demonstrate understanding.
aware_text: write responses to literary or expository texts and provide evidence from the text to demonstrate understanding.

teks_text: Writing/Persuasive Texts. Students write persuasive texts to influence the attitudes or actions of a specific audience on specific issues. Students are expected to write persuasive essays for appropriate audiences that establish a position and use supporting details.
aware_text: write persuasive essays for appropriate audiences that establish a position and use supporting details.

teks_text: Reading/Vocabulary Development. Students understand new vocabulary and use it when reading and writing. Students are expected to:
aware_text: Reading/Vocabulary Development. Students understand new vocabulary and use it when reading and writing.

teks_text: determine the meaning of grade-level academic English words derived from Latin, Greek, or other linguistic roots and affixes;
aware_text: determine the meaning of grade-level academic English words derived from Latin, Greek, or other linguistic roots and affixes.

teks_text: use the context of the sentence (e.g., in-sentence example or definition) to determine the meaning of unfamiliar words or multiple meaning words;
aware_text: use the context of the sentence (e.g., in-sentence example or definition) to determine the meaning of unfamiliar words or multiple meaning words.

teks_text: complete analogies using knowledge of antonyms and synonyms (e.g., boy:girl as male:____ or girl:woman as boy:_____);
aware_text: complete analogies using knowledge of antonyms and synonyms (e.g., boy:girl as male:____ or girl:woman as boy:_____ ).

teks_text: identify the meaning of common idioms; and
aware_text: identify the meaning of common idioms.

teks_text: use a dictionary or glossary to determine the meanings, syllabication, and pronunciation of unknown words.
aware_text: use a dictionary or glossary to determine the meanings, syllabication, and pronunciation of unknown words.

teks_text: Oral and Written Conventions/Conventions. Students understand the function of and use the conventions of academic language when speaking and writing. Students continue to apply earlier standards with greater complexity. Students are expected to:
aware_text: Oral and Written Conventions/Conventions. Students understand the function of and use the conventions of academic language when speaking and writing. Students continue to apply earlier standards with greater complexity.

aware_text: use and understand the function of the following parts of speech in the context of reading, writing, and speaking

teks_text: verbs (irregular verbs);
aware_text: use and understand the function of the following parts of speech in the context of reading, writing, and speaking verbs (irregular verbs).

teks_text: nouns (singular/plural, common/proper);
aware_text: use and understand the function of the following parts of speech in the context of reading, writing, and speaking nouns (singular/plural, common/proper).

teks_text: adjectives (e.g., descriptive, including purpose: sleeping bag, frying pan) and their comparative and superlative forms (e.g., fast, faster, fastest);

teks_text: prepositions and prepositional phrases to convey location, time, direction, or to provide details;
aware_text: use and understand the function of the following parts of speech in the context of reading, writing, and speaking prepositions and prepositional phrases to convey location, time, direction, or to provide details.

teks_text: reflexive pronouns (e.g., myself, ourselves);

aware_text: use and understand the function of the following parts of speech in the context of reading, writing, and speaking correlative conjunctions (e.g., either/or, neither/nor).

teks_text: use time-order transition words and transitions that indicate a conclusion;

teks_text: use the complete subject and the complete predicate in a sentence; and
aware_text: use the complete subject and the complete predicate in a sentence.

teks_text: use complete simple and compound sentences with correct subject-verb agreement.
aware_text: use complete simple and compound sentences with correct subject-verb agreement.

reporting_category: Oral and Written Conventions/Handwriting, Capitalization, and Punctuation
teks_text: Oral and Written Conventions/Handwriting, Capitalization, and Punctuation. Students write legibly and use appropriate capitalization and punctuation conventions in their compositions. Students are expected to:
aware_text: Oral and Written Conventions/Handwriting, Capitalization, and Punctuation. Students write legibly and use appropriate capitalization and punctuation conventions in their compositions.

reporting_category: Oral and Written Conventions/Handwriting, Capitalization, and Punctuation
teks_text: write legibly by selecting cursive script or manuscript printing as appropriate;
aware_text: write legibly by selecting cursive script or manuscript printing as appropriate.

teks_text: use capitalization for:
aware_text: use capitalization for

teks_text: quotation marks.

teks_text: Oral and Written Conventions/Spelling. Students spell correctly. Students are expected to:
aware_text: Oral and Written Conventions/Spelling. Students spell correctly.

teks_text: spell words with more advanced orthographic patterns and rules:
aware_text: spell words with more advanced orthographic patterns and rules plural rules

aware_text: spell words with more advanced orthographic patterns and rules plural rules (e.g., words ending in f as in leaf, leaves; adding -es).

aware_text: spell words with more advanced orthographic patterns and rules double consonants in middle of words.

aware_text: spell words with more advanced orthographic patterns and rules other ways to spell sh (e.g., -sion, -tion, -cian).

teks_text: silent letters (e.g., knee, wring);
aware_text: spell words with more advanced orthographic patterns and rules silent letters (e.g., knee, wring).

teks_text: spell base words and roots with affixes (e.g., -ion, -ment, -ly, dis-, pre-);
aware_text: spell base words and roots with affixes (e.g., -ion, -ment, -ly, dis-, pre-).

teks_text: spell commonly used homophones (e.g., there, they're, their; two, too, to); and
aware_text: spell commonly used homophones (e.g., there, they're, their; two, too, to).

teks_text: Research/Research Plan. Students ask open-ended research questions and develop a plan for answering them. Students are expected to:
aware_text: Research/Research Plan. Students ask open-ended research questions and develop a plan for answering them.

teks_text: generate research topics from personal interests or by brainstorming with others, narrow to one topic, and formulate open-ended questions about the major research topic; and
aware_text: generate research topics from personal interests or by brainstorming with others, narrow to one topic, and formulate open-ended questions about the major research topic.

teks_text: generate a research plan for gathering relevant information (e.g., surveys, interviews, encyclopedias) about the major research question.
aware_text: generate a research plan for gathering relevant information (e.g., surveys, interviews, encyclopedias) about the major research question.

teks_text: Research/Gathering Sources. Students determine, locate, and explore the full range of relevant sources addressing a research question and systematically record the information they gather. Students are expected to:
aware_text: Research/Gathering Sources. Students determine, locate, and explore the full range of relevant sources addressing a research question and systematically record the information they gather.

teks_text: follow the research plan to collect information from multiple sources of information both oral and written, including:
aware_text: follow the research plan to collect information from multiple sources of information both oral and written, including

teks_text: student-initiated surveys, on-site inspections, and interviews;
aware_text: follow the research plan to collect information from multiple sources of information both oral and written, including student-initiated surveys, on-site inspections, and interviews.

teks_text: data from experts, reference texts, and online searches; and
aware_text: follow the research plan to collect information from multiple sources of information both oral and written, including data from experts, reference texts, and online searches.

teks_text: visual sources of information (e.g., maps, timelines, graphs) where appropriate;
aware_text: follow the research plan to collect information from multiple sources of information both oral and written, including visual sources of information (e.g., maps, timelines, graphs) where appropriate.

teks_text: use skimming and scanning techniques to identify data by looking at text features (e.g., bold print, italics);
aware_text: use skimming and scanning techniques to identify data by looking at text features (e.g., bold print, italics).

teks_text: take simple notes and sort evidence into provided categories or an organizer;
aware_text: take simple notes and sort evidence into provided categories or an organizer.

teks_text: identify the author, title, publisher, and publication year of sources; and
aware_text: identify the author, title, publisher, and publication year of sources.

teks_text: differentiate between paraphrasing and plagiarism and identify the importance of citing valid and reliable sources.
aware_text: differentiate between paraphrasing and plagiarism and identify the importance of citing valid and reliable sources.

teks_text: Research/Synthesizing Information. Students clarify research questions and evaluate and synthesize collected information. Students are expected to improve the focus of research as a result of consulting expert sources (e.g., reference librarians and local experts on the topic).
aware_text: improve the focus of research as a result of consulting expert sources (e.g., reference librarians and local experts on the topic).

teks_text: Research/Organizing and Presenting Ideas. Students organize and present their ideas and information according to the purpose of the research and their audience. Students are expected to draw conclusions through a brief written explanation and create a works-cited page from notes, including the author, title, publisher, and publication year for each source used.
aware_text: draw conclusions through a brief written explanation and create a works-cited page from notes, including the author, title, publisher, and publication year for each source used.

teks_text: Listening and Speaking/Listening. Students use comprehension skills to listen attentively to others in formal and informal settings. Students continue to apply earlier standards with greater complexity. Students are expected to:
aware_text: Listening and Speaking/Listening. Students use comprehension skills to listen attentively to others in formal and informal settings. Students continue to apply earlier standards with greater complexity.

teks_text: listen attentively to speakers, ask relevant questions, and make pertinent comments; and
aware_text: listen attentively to speakers, ask relevant questions, and make pertinent comments.

teks_text: follow, restate, and give oral instructions that involve a series of related sequences of action.
aware_text: follow, restate, and give oral instructions that involve a series of related sequences of action.

teks_text: Listening and Speaking/Speaking. Students speak clearly and to the point, using the conventions of language. Students continue to apply earlier standards with greater complexity. Students are expected to express an opinion supported by accurate information, employing eye contact, speaking rate, volume, and enunciation, and the conventions of language to communicate ideas effectively.
aware_text: express an opinion supported by accurate information, employing eye contact, speaking rate, volume, and enunciation, and the conventions of language to communicate ideas effectively.

teks_text: Listening and Speaking/Teamwork. Students work productively with others in teams. Students continue to apply earlier standards with greater complexity. Students are expected to participate in teacher- and student-led discussions by posing and answering questions with appropriate detail and by providing suggestions that build upon the ideas of others.
aware_text: participate in teacher- and student-led discussions by posing and answering questions with appropriate detail and by providing suggestions that build upon the ideas of others.

reporting_category: Reading/Comprehension of Literary Text/Theme and Genre
teks_text: Reading/Comprehension of Literary Text/Theme and Genre. Students analyze, make inferences and draw conclusions about theme and genre in different cultural, historical, and contemporary contexts and provide evidence from the text to support their understanding. Students are expected to:
aware_text: Reading/Comprehension of Literary Text/Theme and Genre. Students analyze, make inferences and draw conclusions about theme and genre in different cultural, historical, and contemporary contexts and provide evidence from the text to support their understanding.

reporting_category: Reading/Comprehension of Literary Text/Theme and Genre
teks_text: summarize and explain the lesson or message of a work of fiction as its theme; and
aware_text: summarize and explain the lesson or message of a work of fiction as its theme.

reporting_category: Reading/Comprehension of Literary Text/Theme and Genre
teks_text: compare and contrast the adventures or exploits of characters (e.g., the trickster) in traditional and classical literature.
aware_text: compare and contrast the adventures or exploits of characters (e.g., the trickster) in traditional and classical literature.

teks_text: Reading/Comprehension of Literary Text/Poetry. Students understand, make inferences and draw conclusions about the structure and elements of poetry and provide evidence from text to support their understanding. Students are expected to explain how the structural elements of poetry (e.g., rhyme, meter, stanzas, line breaks) relate to form (e.g., lyrical poetry, free verse).
aware_text: explain how the structural elements of poetry (e.g., rhyme, meter, stanzas, line breaks) relate to form (e.g., lyrical poetry, free verse).

teks_text: Reading/Comprehension of Literary Text/Drama. Students understand, make inferences and draw conclusions about the structure and elements of drama and provide evidence from text to support their understanding. Students are expected to describe the structural elements particular to dramatic literature.
aware_text: describe the structural elements particular to dramatic literature.

teks_text: Reading/Comprehension of Literary Text/Fiction. Students understand, make inferences and draw conclusions about the structure and elements of fiction and provide evidence from text to support their understanding. Students are expected to:
aware_text: Reading/Comprehension of Literary Text/Fiction. Students understand, make inferences and draw conclusions about the structure and elements of fiction and provide evidence from text to support their understanding.

teks_text: sequence and summarize the plot's main events and explain their influence on future events;
aware_text: sequence and summarize the plot's main events and explain their influence on future events.

teks_text: describe the interaction of characters including their relationships and the changes they undergo; and
aware_text: describe the interaction of characters including their relationships and the changes they undergo.

teks_text: identify whether the narrator or speaker of a story is first or third person.
aware_text: identify whether the narrator or speaker of a story is first or third person.

teks_text: Reading/Comprehension of Literary Text/Literary Nonfiction. Students understand, make inferences and draw conclusions about the varied structural patterns and features of literary nonfiction and provide evidence from text to support their understanding. Students are expected to identify similarities and differences between the events and characters' experiences in a fictional work and the actual events and experiences described in an author's biography or autobiography.
aware_text: identify similarities and differences between the events and characters' experiences in a fictional work and the actual events and experiences described in an author's biography or autobiography.

teks_text: Reading/Comprehension of Literary Text/Sensory Language. Students understand, make inferences and draw conclusions about how an author's sensory language creates imagery in literary text and provide evidence from text to support their understanding. Students are expected to identify the author's use of similes and metaphors to produce imagery.
aware_text: identify the author's use of similes and metaphors to produce imagery.

teks_text: Reading/Comprehension of Text/Independent Reading. Students read independently for sustained periods of time and produce evidence of their reading. Students are expected to read independently for a sustained period of time and paraphrase what the reading was about, maintaining meaning and logical order (e.g., generate a reading log or journal; participate in book talks).
aware_text: read independently for a sustained period of time and paraphrase what the reading was about, maintaining meaning and logical order (e.g., generate a reading log or journal; participate in book talks).
